Articles.Content: Has anyone consider making rope that tethers kerbalnauts to the ship while they EVA. You know a "just in case" situation where they've no longer have enough fuel to get back?

In before the NO TETHERS s***storm.

Every once in a while (it feels like quite often), someone asks for this. It always blows up into a "not possible atm, gtfo" situation.

Suffice it to say, yes. It's been thought of. No there's no good approach to it yet. Soon.

It is entirely possible to do this atm. I'm doing something similiar with the tractor beams i got on lazor system. All you'd have to do would be to change the lazor into a rope model. I'd just define some points along the rope and add a bezier curve of cylinder meshes between them. Then it's just a matter of mimicing physics for the points you have defined. i.e. moving them towards the direction of gravity and simulate elastic movement.

And how do you change the lazor into a rope model ?

It's possible to load a model programmatically in KSP and stretch it on the Z axis to make a simple rope ? (like fuel line and strut in the vab editor) ?
